c403c01b7b07.title: Nice article Mark, I indeed prefer LA over SF, affordability is not to be underrated.

paragraphs.text: Nice article Mark, I indeed prefer LA over SF, affordability is not to be underrated. I think the general attitude is much better too, there just needs to be a tad more tech literature. But unlike SV, there are a lot of other industries that are tapping into tech and becoming the next big markets to require Internet services: entertainment, fashion…

a1858437b70.title: Seems like another significant impact is the shift from an information focused web to an…

paragraphs.text: Seems like another significant impact is the shift from an information focused web to an entertainment based web where more and more people are coming to the internet to be entertained and informed. Shift is likely a combination of cultural norms changing and confluence of technologies for video, always with us mobile devices, and higher bandwidth…
paragraphs.name: 2ad0

f6c2b1beb620.title: Thank you so much for being a big supporter of all 3 of us over the last couple of years Mark…

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for being a big supporter of all 3 of us over the last couple of years Mark Suster! We have lots to learn from you in terms of building a great venture franchise and look forward to working more closely in the coming years.
paragraphs.name: de4f

77ff87f0c7ae.title: Thanks for sharing your thoughts, Mark.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing your thoughts, Mark. I would agree in that LA’s horizon certainly looks extremely bright. Especially since I’m moving back in a couple weeks! 👊🏻 (bias, but not important…)

Paul Azous, CEO,

4dba0388dd32.title: We’ve recently moved from SF (back to) LA for lots of reasons, one of which is that the lifestyle…

paragraphs.text: We’ve recently moved from SF (back to) LA for lots of reasons, one of which is that the lifestyle in LA seems to be far more enjoyable than in SF. That’s subjective of course, but the difference in people enjoying life outside of work is palpable when you live in both cities.
paragraphs.name: c838

21d50f997063.title: Extremely exciting to see the LA startup scene growing!

paragraphs.text: Extremely exciting to see the LA startup scene growing!
paragraphs.name: f9a3

paragraphs.text: Mark,
paragraphs.name: 2bc7

paragraphs.text: You clearly shaped the startup culture in LA, which seems to be collaborative and welcoming. The way you introduced Fika Ventures is one of many examples. Upfront is on the top of most entrepreneur’s list of preferred investors. But, with such a strong endorsement of Fika’s founders, it’s clear Fika would make a great partner.
paragraphs.name: ec2a

59f05f23cc2e.title: The rockets that put men on the moon were designed by Werner Von Braun, a member of the Nazi Party…

paragraphs.text: The rockets that put men on the moon were designed by Werner Von Braun, a member of the Nazi Party & SS, who used slave labour for the Third Reich’s rocket program [1]. His NASA bio [2] glosses over all that.
paragraphs.name: bf8a

paragraphs.text: [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun
paragraphs.name: 303c

paragraphs.text: [2] https://history.msfc.nasa.gov/vonbraun/bio.html
paragraphs.name: 360c

537a56d622d8.title: There are a ton of funds out there now forming just to buy companies and portfolios of starts up.

paragraphs.text: There are a ton of funds out there now forming just to buy companies and portfolios of starts up. The idea being one out of 50 may make a ton of money.
paragraphs.name: c06f

paragraphs.text: Paul Azous

b2b1a06288d4.title: Thank you Mark for lighting the fuse for the LA & OC tech community.

paragraphs.text: Thank you Mark for lighting the fuse for the LA & OC tech community. I was born and lived in West LA for most of my youth, went to UCLA, lived in the San Francisco area for 10 years, now in Orange County for over 10 years. The LA & OC county areas are the best places to live. Now we need the HyperLoop to enjoy SF & LA. Great video.
paragraphs.name: c6ec
